title: Crocodile Was Originally Female
summary: The most popular fan theory about Crocodile's weakness is that he was originally assigned female at birth and Ivankov used the Horm-Horm Fruit to change his sex. Some versions of this theory even suggest Crocodile could be Luffy's mother.
fullText: One of the biggest mysteries in One Piece stems from episode 443, where Ivankov reveals he knows a 'precious weakness' from Crocodile's past. The most popular theory is that Crocodile was AFAB (assigned female at birth) and Ivankov, with his Horm-Horm Fruit powers, helped change Crocodile's biological sex when they met during Crocodile's rookie days. This would explain why it's such an embarrassing secret that Crocodile would do anything to hide, as it could damage his fearsome reputation. Some fans have even speculated that Crocodile could be Luffy's biological mother, though this is considered an extreme version of the theory. Supporting evidence includes Crocodile's androgynous appearance in some early sketches, Ivankov's specific powers, and the fact that Crocodile's Vivre Card databook entry confirms he has a weakness from his past that he owes Ivankov for helping with.
author: Multiple Reddit and forum users

source.title: One Piece: Ivankov & Crocodile's Mysterious History, Theories Explained

title: Crocodile Was a Celestial Dragon Slave
summary: An alternative theory suggests that Crocodile was once a slave to the Celestial Dragons, along with other characters like Ivankov and Kuma, and the slave mark on his left hand is why he has a hook instead.
fullText: Another popular theory about Crocodile's weakness involves him being a former slave of the Celestial Dragons. This theory suggests that Crocodile, like Boa Hancock and possibly Bartholomew Kuma, was enslaved by the World Nobles and branded with the Hoof of the Soaring Dragon mark. To hide this shameful past, Crocodile supposedly cut off his left hand (explaining his iconic hook) where the brand would have been located. This would make his 'weakness' not a physical vulnerability but a dark secret from his past that could destroy his reputation if revealed. Ivankov, as a Revolutionary Army commander who likely helped free slaves, would have knowledge of this secret. This theory fits with One Piece's recurring themes of slavery, freedom, and the corrupt nature of the World Government.
author: Reddit and One Piece community theorists

source.title: One Piece: Crocodile's Real Secret Explains Why He Has a Hook

title: Jinbe Will Eventually Join the Straw Hats
summary: Following episode 443 where Jinbe volunteers to help Luffy save Ace, many fans theorized that this was foreshadowing for Jinbe eventually becoming a Straw Hat crew member.
fullText: When Jinbe volunteered to join Luffy's team in episode 443, stating his willingness to die for Ace and fight alongside Luffy, many fans immediately began theorizing that this was setting up Jinbe to eventually join the Straw Hat Pirates as their helmsman. The theory was based on several factors: Jinbe's noble character aligning with Straw Hat values, his incredible strength making him a valuable addition, his Fish-Man heritage filling a needed crew diversity role, and the emotional connection being formed between him and Luffy through their shared desire to save Ace. Fans noted that every Straw Hat member has had a significant character arc before joining, and Jinbe's role in the Impel Down and Marineford events could serve as his arc. This theory was considered highly plausible given Oda's tendency to plant seeds for future developments early on.
author: One Piece fan community
